title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Yellen made the case for another sweeping economic aid package at her hearing to be the next Treasury secretary, pushing back against Republican skepticism about the need for more deficit spending to bolster the recovery.

---

Netflix ended 2020 with more than 200 million subscribers, a milestone powered by homebound consumers and rising demand in international markets.

---

Goldman said fourth-quarter profit more than doubled as it posted revenue of $11.74 billion, results that were much better than analysts' expectations.

---

BofA's profit fell 22% in the latest quarter as a drop in interest income helped drag down earnings.

---

Embattled billionaire Jack Ma made his first public appearance in nearly three months.

---

Office Depot rebuffed an unsolicited takeover offer from Staples but indicated it is open to an alternative deal.

---

MGM Resorts said it is no longer pursuing a deal to buy British gambling company Entain.

---

U.S. stocks rose, with the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq gaining 0.8%, 0.4% and 1.5%, respectively.

---

Microsoft is investing inGeneral Motors'driverless-car startup Cruise as part of a strategic tie-up.

---

Rivian has raised another $2.65 billion, bolstering the electric-vehicle startup's balance sheet.
